Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Health if his attention has been drawn to the fact that £220,000 has been raised by the committee for care of the elderly at Graiguenamanagh, County Kilkenny, for the provision of old persons' homes; if his attention has further been drawn to the fact that a contractor has been employed to carry out the building; when he will make the funds from his Department available to the committee; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Health (Dr. O'Hanlon) Rory O'Hanlon
Speaker.P: I have received an application on behalf of the Graiguenamanagh Elderly Association for a grant from national lottery funds towards the cost of building a welfare home and day care facilities. I have been informed by the South-Eastern Health Board that the association has raised £120,000 for the project, which also includes sheltered housing accommodation and that the local authority allocated a non-repayable loan of £143,000 in respect of the proposed sheltered housing, under the scheme to assist voluntary bodies to provide housing accommodation for elderly and other disadvantaged persons. This project will be considered together with other projects for funding in 1988.

asked the Minister for Education if, given the serious accommodation problem which now exists at Coláiste Bríde, Clondalkin, Dublin 22, she will sanction construction of the extension which was promised in May 1986.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: It is not possible to say at this stage when construction work will commence. The rate at which this project, as with other capital projects of this nature, will proceed will depend on the availability of capital resources and on my Department's other commitments and priorities.

asked the Minister for Education if her attention has been drawn to the appalling state of the school in Castlecomer, County Kilkenny; and if she will make a statement as to when funds will be available for building at the school.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: I am aware of the condition of the school at present. Architectural planning of the new Community School for Castlecomer is completed and tenders were received some time ago. However, it is not possible in the light of the capital restrictions for 1988, to allow work to proceed on this project.

asked the Minister for Education her proposals for the provision of extra facilities at St. Corban's national school, Naas, County Kildare; whether she proposes to provide the required facilities in the near future; the extent of the agreed required facilities; the time-scale whereby it is envisaged to provide the facilities; whether the extension proposed is to be of a permanent or a temporary nature; the expected local contribution in this case; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: The Deputy is understood to refer to Scoil Corbáin, the national school conducted by the Christian Brothers at Naas, County Kildare. My Department has been unable to establish the nature of the extra facilities about which the Deputy is inquiring. If he will provide more details about the subject matter of his question, I shall have inquiries made and inform him of the outcome.

asked the Minister for Education if it is intended to allocate funds for capital purposes to the GAA from the national lottery; whether her Department has received a specific request for such funding; the likely amount of grant, if any, involved; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: A total of £4 million has been provided from the national lottery surplus for the capital grant scheme for the provision of recreational facilities operated by my Department. The scheme is open to all voluntary bodies and is designed to assist and encourage local initiatives in the provision of youth, sport and community facilities throughout the country.

GAA clubs throughout the country are eligible to apply under the scheme. Before the availability of a grant can be considered for any project, however, it is necessary for formal applications to be submitted to my Department for consideration under the terms of the scheme. Formal application forms and conditions of the scheme may be obtained from my Department's Youth Affairs Section, 11th Floor, Hawkins House.
A number of individual GAA clubs have already submitted applications and these are currently receiving consideration within my Department.

asked the Minister for Education the current situation with regard to the provision of an extension to the Ballymore Eustace national school, County Kildare; whether it is likely that this extension will be provided in 1988; if she accepts the urgent need for the provision of these facilities; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: Tender documentation has been prepared for the provision of an extension to Ballymore Eustace national school, County Kildare. Because, however, of the demands on the capital being made available in 1988 to my Department for its national school building programme, it is unlikely that an allocation can be made towards the cost of this project in the current financial year.

Speaker.hpid: Mr. J. Mitchell Mr. J. Mitchell
Speaker.P: asked the Minister for Education if her attention has been drawn to the fact that St. Raphael's national school, Ballyfermot, Dublin 10, has no caretaker; if she is prepared to arrange for a caretaker to be provided either directly or under the social employment scheme or under any similar scheme; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke) Minister for Education (Mrs. O'Rourke)
Speaker.P: As the scheme for the employment of caretaker staff is being phased out, it is not open to my Department to approve the appointment of a caretaker in St. Raphael's national school. The administration of the social employment scheme is the responsibility of the Minister for Labour.
